THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON

Pisin
Crl.MC.No.9295 OF 2019(B) 2020/KER/II63
3
ORDER
Dated this the 9th day of January, 2020

The petitioners are accused in C.C No. 1517/2016 on the
files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-1, Nedumagad for
having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 143,
147, 148, 149, 294[b] and 324 read with Section 109 of the IPC. The
defacto complainant-injured is the 2"? respondent who has appeared
through counsel and filed an affidavit to the effect that the matter has
been amicably settled with the petitioners and that he did not not
have any grievance against them. A report also has been obtained
from the Investigating Officer to that effect. The petitioners do not
have any criminal antecedents. There is no public interest involved.

In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire
proceedings in C.C No.1517/2016 on the files of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court-1, Nedumagad stands quashed

Pisin

3
ORDER
Dated this the 9th day of January, 2020

The petitioners are accused in C.C No. 1517/2016 on the
files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-1, Nedumagad for
having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 143,
147, 148, 149, 294[b] and 324 read with Section 109 of the IPC. The
defacto complainant-injured is the 2"? respondent who has appeared
through counsel and filed an affidavit to the effect that the matter has
been amicably settled with the petitioners and that he did not not
have any grievance against them. A report also has been obtained
from the Investigating Officer to that effect. The petitioners do not
have any criminal antecedents. There is no public interest involved.

In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire
proceedings in C.C No.1517/2016 on the files of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court-1, Nedumagad stands quashed under Section
482 Cr.P.C and the accused are discharged.

Sd/-
ASHOK MENON
JUDGE
